definition: to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)

sentences.english: See the martial arts will be crowned and win the game.
sentences.chinese: 眼看武馆馆主将要反败为胜。

sentences.english: He didn't take the best winning chances, and was beaten by his opponent instead.
sentences.chinese: 他没有抓住最好的胜机，结果被对手反败为胜了。

sentences.english: Comereturning Gives China A Sensineas Thomonce Cup Win. (The Comereturning Gaudio-videoe China A Sensineas Thomonce Cup Win. )
sentences.chinese: 中国队反败为胜荣获汤姆斯杯。

sentences.english: Comeback Gives China A Sensational Thomas Cup Win. (The Comeback Gave China A Sensational Thomas Cup Win. )
sentences.chinese: 中国队反败为胜荣获汤姆斯杯。

sentences.english: But public opinion polls suggest that McCain will have to climb out of a deep hole.
sentences.chinese: 但是民调结果显示麦凯恩将难以反败为胜。

sentences.english: After a disastrous first half the team fought back to win.
sentences.chinese: 该队在上半场惨败后重整旗鼓反败为胜。

sentences.english: Our team turned the tables in the last five minutes by scoring two goals successively.
sentences.chinese: 我队在最后五分钟内连进两球，反败为胜。

definition: to turn defeat into victory (idiom); snatching victory from the jaws of defeat
to make a comeback/(of a doctor's assessment of the gender of a fetus) to turn out to be wrong
lit. to upend heaven and earth (idiom)/fig. to change the course of events/to turn things around
using the weak to defeat the strong (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
victorious/to win/to triumph
lost game/losing battle
grasp it and victory is assured/to have success within one's grasp (idiom)
to escape unscathed/to get through in one piece
to win by a surprise move
to score a victory/to prevail over one's opponents
to defeat/to beat
to win as a result of tenacious effort/to fight off tough competition
to do sth when least expected (idiom); to catch sb off guard
lit. fight with one's back to the river (idiom); fig. to fight to win or die
to prevail/to achieve victory/to be victorious
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert disaster
